lead_paragraph: Curtis Strange and Hubert Green, each winners of 2 majors and 17 tournaments on the PGA Tour, were among six golfers inducted into the World Golf Hall of Fame last night.Se Ri Pak of South Korea was inducted based on the L.P.G.A. Tour’s points system, which she surpassed three years ago, combined with 10 years on the women’s Tour.Strange, elected on the PGA Tour ballot with 70 percent of the vote, was the last golfer to win consecutive United States Opens, in 1988-89. Green, 60, captured the 1977 United States Open and the 1985 P.G.A. Championship. Joe Carr, the first Irishman to be inducted; Kel Nagle of Australia, who won the 1960 British Open; and Charles Blair Macdonald, who designed the National Golf Links in Southampton, N.Y., were the other inductees.
